text: To request a Transcript of Records (TOR), visit the Registrar's Office at the Main Campus or apply online via the ODRS. Processing takes 15-20 working days.
The University Registrar's Office is located at the Ground Floor of the Main Building, Sta. Mesa Campus. Open 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
The Accounting/Cashier's Office handles all fee payments. Located at the Main Building Ground Floor. Hours: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
The Office of Student Services (OSS) is at the Student Center Building. Handles IDs, organizations, scholarships, and complaints.
The PUP Main Library is at the center of Sta. Mesa Campus. Requires validated ID. Open 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM on weekdays.
The University Health Service provides free medical and dental care. Located near the Main Gate. Bring validated ID.
Guidance Office offers counseling, testing, and career services. Located at the Student Center. Appointments recommended.
ICT Office handles email, SIS, and WiFi issues. Located at the Computer Center. Submit tickets via PUP Helpdesk portal.
Security Office operates 24/7. Emergency hotline posted at gates. Lost items go to Main Gate security.
ODRS (Online Document Request System) allows remote requests for TOR, diploma, and certifications. Access via PUP portal.
PUP CEA is located at the NDC Compound, Pureza St., Santa Mesa, Manila. Separate from the Main Campus.
CEA Building at NDC Compound is open from 6:30 AM to 8:30 PM on weekdays. Weekend access requires permission.
CEA Library on 3rd Floor has engineering/architecture collections. Open 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. ID required.
CEA Computer Labs on 4th Floor for AutoCAD, Revit, and engineering software. Lab schedule posted weekly.
Drafting Rooms on 3rd Floor for architecture/engineering drawing classes. Personal tools not provided.
CEA Auditorium seats 300. Reservation requires Dean's approval at least 2 weeks in advance.
Student Lounge on 2nd Floor open for breaks. Maintain cleanliness; food allowed only in designated areas.
CEA Research Center on 4th Floor supports thesis and faculty research. Access requires faculty endorsement.
Limited parking at NDC Compound for faculty/staff only. Student parking extremely limited; no overnight parking.
CEA Canteen operates 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Cash only. Vegetarian options available.
CAF is located at the Main Campus, Sta. Mesa. The CAF Building is near the Main Library.
CAF Dean's Office is on the 2nd Floor. Handles academic concerns, petitions, and approvals.
CPA Review Center offers review sessions for graduating students. Registration opens each semester.
CAF Computer Lab on 3rd Floor has accounting software (QuickBooks, SAP). Lab card required.
JPIA (Junior Philippine Institute of Accountants) office is in the CAF Student Lounge.
Tax Laboratory simulates BIR processes. Used for tax accounting courses only.
Audit Simulation Room for auditing courses. Reservation through department chair.
CAF Resource Center has accounting standards, journals, and past board exam materials.
CAF-specific scholarships available. Inquire at the Dean's Office each semester.
CAF Alumni Network offers mentoring and job placement. Connect via CAF Alumni Office.
CAL is at the Main Campus, Sta. Mesa. The CAL Building houses humanities departments.
CAL Writing Center offers free writing tutorials. Schedule at the Dean's Office.
CAL Theater seats 200. Used for performances, rehearsals, and classes. Reservation required.
Language Laboratory on 3rd Floor for foreign language courses. Headset provided.
'Malay' Literary Journal office on 2nd Floor accepts student submissions annually.
CAL Art Gallery exhibits student and faculty works. Visiting hours: 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM.
CAL Radio Studio for broadcasting students. Requires faculty supervision.
CAL Research Room for thesis writing. Quiet area with reference materials.
CAL Faculty Lounge on 2nd Floor. Student consultations by appointment only.
CAL organizes poetry readings, film screenings, and cultural talks. Calendar posted monthly.
CBA is at the Main Campus, Sta. Mesa. CBA Building is near the South Gate.
CBA Dean's Office on 3rd Floor handles business program concerns and approvals.
Case Study Rooms equipped for business simulations. Reserve through department secretaries.
Trading Room simulates stock market for finance courses. Access during scheduled sessions.
Entrepreneurship Incubator supports student startups. Apply each semester.
MBA Program Office handles graduate business programs. Separate from undergraduate office.
Business Research Center provides market data and research tools for thesis.
CBA Computer Lab has business software (SPSS, Stata). Open for enrolled business students.
CBA Lecture Hall seats 150. Used for seminars and guest speaker events.
CBA Alumni Mentoring Program connects students with business professionals.
COC is at the Main Campus, Sta. Mesa. The COC Building houses media facilities.
COC TV Studio with broadcast equipment. Requires faculty supervision and reservation.
Radio Broadcasting Booth for on-air training. Schedule through studio manager.
Video Editing Suites with Adobe Suite. Priority for production classes.
Equipment Room loans cameras, audio gear. Requires ID deposit and production permit.
PUP Newsroom produces campus news. Open to COC students interested in journalism.
Screening Room for film viewings and critiques. Seats 50.
Photography Studio with lighting equipment. For photography classes only.
Communication Research Center assists with surveys and data analysis.
Student Production Office for organizing media projects. Key access required.
CCIS is at the Main Campus, Sta. Mesa. CCIS Building is adjacent to Main Library.
Server Room access restricted to authorized personnel only. No student access without faculty.
Networking Laboratory for CCNA/network courses. Equipment must not be removed.
Software Development Lab for programming courses. Open 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM.
Cybersecurity Range for ethical hacking courses. Isolated network environment.
Capstone Project Room for thesis groups. Reserve one month in advance.
Hardware Laboratory for computer assembly and repair courses. Tools provided.
Coding Dojo for practice and competitions. Open during coding club hours.
Data Center access requires special permission. For advanced courses only.
Game Development Lab for game design courses. Specialized equipment available.
COED is at the Main Campus, Sta. Mesa. COED Building houses education departments.
Demonstration Classrooms with observation mirrors for teaching practicums.
Instructional Materials Center provides teaching aids and lesson plan samples.
Child Development Center for early childhood education practicum.
LET Review Sessions offered each semester. Registration at COED Dean's Office.
Practice Teaching Office coordinates school placements for student teachers.
Curriculum Laboratory for developing teaching modules and materials.
Assessment Center for educational testing and evaluation training.
Education Resource Library with textbooks and teaching references.
COED Faculty Lounge for student consultations. Sign-up sheet at entrance.
